title: House Speaker Ryan: House likely to pass U.S. budget deal
text:
February 8, 2018 / 2:19 PM / in 24 minutes CORRECTED-House Speaker Ryan: House likely to pass U.S. budget deal Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
(Adds dropped words in quote) 
WASHINGTON, Feb 8 (Reuters) - U.S. House of Representatives Speaker Paul Ryan said on Thursday he believed there would be enough votes in the House to pass a bipartisan budget agreement reached in the Senate. 
“I think we will. I feel good. Part of it depends on the Democrats. This is a bipartisan bill. It’s going to need bipartisan support,” Ryan told radio host Hugh Hewitt. “We are going to deliver our share of support. I feel very good about Republicans. Our members who are focused on the military are very happy where we landed on that.” (Reporting by Makini Brice; Editing by Jonathan Oatis)
